conversation.content:
[anxious] So they offered me the promotion today and I... I said yes. Obviously. I mean, it's everything I've worked for, right? The salary, the title, the whole thing. [pause] But they told me about the restructuring and, um... God, half the team. Half. [very quietly] And I have to be the one who tells them.

[shaky voice] Sarah's got two kids in college. Mike just bought that house—he showed me pictures last week, he was so excited about the backyard. [sigh] And here I am, sitting on this information like some kind of... I don't know, like I'm betraying them every time they smile at me in the hallway.

[bitter] They keep congratulating me. "Oh congrats on the promotion!" And I just stand there, nodding, saying thanks, knowing that in three weeks I'll be calling them into my office—my new office—and destroying their lives. [frustrated] What am I supposed to do, turn it down? Someone else would just take it and do the same thing anyway.

[very sad] I keep thinking maybe I can save some of them, you know? Like, maybe if I fight hard enough or... but they already gave me the list. [trailing off] It's already decided.

subject: Getting promoted to management while knowing you'll have to lay off half your former coworkers next month
